titleStmt.title: A sparing restraint, of many lauishe vntruthes, which M. Doctor Harding do the chalenge, in the first article of my Lorde of Sarisburies replie. By Edward Dering student in Diuinitie. With an answere vnto that long, and vncourteous epistle, entituled to M. Juel, and set before M. Hardings Reioinder
titleStmt.author: Dering, Edward, 1540?-1576.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Henry Denham, for Humfrey Toy, dwelling in Poules Church yarde, at the signe of the Helmet,

notesStmt.note: In two parts, with continuous signatures and separate pagination.
Part 1 running title reads: An aunswere to M. Hardings epistle.
Part 2 running title reads: An aunswere to M. Hardings reioinder.

In answer to Thomas Harding's "A reioinder to M. Jewels Replie", published in 1566, which was one of a series of controversial works written as a result of John Jewel's "Apologia pro Ecclesia Anglicana", published in 1562.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
